items.summary: The owners of Anna Creek Station, the biggest cattle station in the world, have been charged over allegedly building illegal dams on inland rivers and waterholes in outback South Australia.

items.title: Australian man Peter Williams faces lengthy US jail term after selling trade secrets to Russian broker
items.summary: Intelligence insider Peter Williams faces more than a decade in a US jail after pleading guilty to selling a Russian broker his employer's trade secrets.

items.title: Stark new figures reveal outcomes of alleged childcare abuse investigations
items.summary: Despite increasing rates of reporting over the last five years, few investigations have resulted in strong action by the NSW regulator.

items.title: Regulator fines crypto ATM operator Cryptolink as part of crackdown that is too late for many
items.summary: A pensioner tells her nightmarish story as the financial crimes regulator takes action against a second Australian player in the booming crypto ATM business linked to lucrative scams and money laundering.

items.title: Bendigo mother helps others survive postnatal mental health struggle
items.summary: After battling suicidal thoughts as a new mother, Monique Aulich now supports others going through the same pain.

items.title: Sunscreen maker at centre of recalls blocked by US regulator for years
items.summary: The Australian sunscreen manufacturer at the centre of a spate of recent product recalls has been blocked from exporting sunscreens to the United States for the past three years.

items.title: Older people risk losing some at-home services despite 'no worse off' promise
items.summary: With major changes to the aged care system looming this week, price hikes for older people accessing support at home could mean their aged care packages will not stretch as far.

items.title: Melbourne sites with horrific histories embrace a little spookiness this Halloween
items.summary: Two former prisons, including at least one "haunted" cell, are throwing open their doors for Halloween festivities this Friday.

items.title: Labor is frustrated with Rio Tinto as 'all options' on table for Tomago smelter
items.summary: The government can't hide its frustration with Rio Tinto, but at the same time it's preparing to dip deeper into taxpayers' pockets to help the company out. Again.

items.title: WOMADelaide 2026 first line-up announced: full list of artists and dates
items.summary: Icons, innovators, and unexpected gems — WOMADelaide's 2026 line-up promises a truly unique festival experience.

items.title: Australian Diamonds defeat Silver Ferns to claim Constellation Cup in extra-time thriller
items.summary: The Diamonds's trophy cabinet is again complete after they snapped their New Zealand drought against the Silver Ferns in a thrilling extra-time period to bring the Constellation Cup back to Australia.

items.title: Attempted murder trial of man who stabbed Australian girl in London dropped on psychiatric grounds
items.summary: UK authorities drop attempted murder trial against a man who stabbed an 11-year-old Australian girl in London in August 2024 on psychiatric grounds.

items.title: Rain washes out first Australia—India men's T20I at Canberra's Manuka Oval
items.summary: India is left frustrated after rain washed out the men's T20I series opener against Australia at a cold and dreary Manuka Oval.

items.title: Jesse Wahlen Beale, accused of killing partner Crystal Beale, and dumping body, denied bail
items.summary: Court hears Jesse Wahlen Beale, who is accused of killing his partner Crystal Beale before dumping her body, made Google searches about river tidal movements and CCTV cameras around the time of her death.

items.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Man jailed for ramming car through gates of Russian consulate in Sydney
items.summary: Confronting body-worn footage showing the incident was played in court during the sentencing of 40-year-old Rimi Abraham.

items.title: Canberra man jailed over the theft of Virgin van he drove around Canberra Airport's tarmac
items.summary: A man who drove through the airport's perimeter fence three times in 2023 has been sentenced in the ACT Supreme Court.

items.title: How Hurricane Melissa was supercharged by hot oceans in the Caribbean
items.summary: Dubbed the "storm of the century", Hurricane Melissa shook off three different meteorological conditions that normally weaken major hurricanes.

items.title: David Fifita reunites with Wayne Bennett at South Sydney Rabbitohs, ending five-season stint at Gold Coast Titans
items.summary: After flirting with exits from the Titans previously, David Fifita makes his move official, joining the South Sydney Rabbitohs on a deal for the next two seasons.

items.title: How this is 'easily the most competitive season' of AFLW outside of North Melbourne
items.summary: The final round of the AFLW home and away season promises to be nervous watching for more than half the competition's fans as eleven sides battle for seven finals spots up for grabs.

items.title: Tasmanian politicians meet with AFL over contentious Hobart stadium proposal
items.summary: A group of Tasmanian politicians opposed to the proposed Hobart stadium has failed to convince the AFL to abandon the contentious project during a meeting in Melbourne.

items.title: Lily Allen's West End Girl strikes a chord with other artists turning break-ups into art
items.summary: Lily Allen has dropped her first album in seven years and it is... revealing. We asked Australian artists about turning pain into power, and why break-up songs resonate so deeply with fans.

items.title: Broken Hill resident sick of thieves stealing Slag Street sign
items.summary: Broken Hill resident Sid Siddall worries a lack of signage could result in emergency services being unable to find him the next time he needs urgent help.

items.title: Gareth Ward sentencing delayed due to legal dispute over criminal offence rules
items.summary: The sentencing of former NSW Liberal minister Gareth Ward is postponed while the court considers which set of sentencing rules applies to his offences.

items.title: Algerian oak facing removal for transmission lines wins Tree of the Year
items.summary: Residents of a small Victorian town hope a Tree of the Year award will save a beloved Algerian oak from being chopped down to make way for transmission lines.

items.title: AFL confirms arrival of last disposal rule as one of seven changes for 2026 season
items.summary: The AFL confirms the arrival of the last disposal rule as one of seven rule changes aimed at making umpires' jobs easier while shortening the length of games.

items.title: Inflation data kills November rate cut chances as RBA faces headache
items.summary: A November rate cut is dead, buried and cremated. It now looks far from certain that interest rates will fall again at all.

items.title: Liberal MPs question Sussan Ley's attack on Albanese's Joy Division shirt
items.summary: Sussan Ley stands by her criticism of the prime minister for wearing a Joy Division T-shirt while stepping off a plane last week. Privately, some of her Liberal colleagues are questioning the attack.

items.title: George Orwell's Animal Farm gets AI makeover as students learn about online influence
items.summary: George Orwell's Animal Farm is being used to help high schoolers identify how AI can be used to influence opinion, build power and shape narratives.

items.title: Matildas launch fierce defence of Sam Kerr amid criticism of captaincy call
items.summary: Sam Kerr's coach and teammates aren't second-guessing the decision to re-install her as Matildas captain after returning to the field following a lengthy lay-off.

items.title: Sheffield Shield: Steve Smith scores timely century ahead of Ashes as Sam Konstas, Cam Green and Beau Webster fail to fire
items.summary: Steve Smith makes a triumphant return to New South Wales's Sheffield Shield side but his fellow Australian Test players don't have the same impact as they look to secure their Ashes spots.

items.title: Vietnam tourist sites submerged as record rainfall causes major flooding
items.summary: Heavy rains cause major flooding in central Vietnam, while a category five hurricane rages on the other side of the world in the Caribbean.

items.title: John Cleese leads tributes to 'perfect' on-screen wife Prunella Scales
items.summary: Prunella Scales has been remembered as part of the golden era of British comedy for her numerous roles across film, TV and theatre.

items.title: Hughenden locals fed up with water quality as CopperString project looms
items.summary: Hughenden business owner Jodie Coward says she has not drank water straight from the tap in two years.

items.title: Indoor cricket to no longer receive operational and financial support from Cricket Australia
items.summary: Cricket Australia has conceded it has an "unsustainable" cost base, after cutting operational and financial support for indoor cricket and leaving the sport to manage itself.

items.title: Darwin wakes to shaking from magnitude-6.4 earthquake in Banda Sea
items.summary: People across the Northern Territory's Top End woke to shaking in the early hours during a magnitude-6.4 earthquake in the Banda Sea near Timor-Leste.

items.title: Workers stood down from GFG Alliance Tahmoor coal mine expect hard times
items.summary: Half the workforce at the Tahmoor Colliery in NSW has been stood down without pay, with workers and their families facing weeks of financial uncertainty.

items.title: World-first preterm birth prevention program has lowered the rate of early births by about 4,000 a year
items.summary: A program introduced in Australia in 2018 has led to thousands of fewer babies born early each year, according to a new study.

items.title: Dubbo's Carol Mudford wins AgriFutures Rural Women's Award
items.summary: Carol Mudford's grassroots charity, sHedway, is dedicated to suicide prevention and positive mental health in the shearing industry.

items.title: Powerhouse seeks ideas for 100-year time capsule to be buried at Parramatta site opening
items.summary: The Powerhouse Museum buried technologies such as a solar calculator and cardboard box camera in 1981. Now they want to know what to bury in 2026.

items.title: Bureau of Meteorology ordered to fix new website after torrent of complaints
items.summary: Environment Minister Murray Watt tells the Bureau of Meteorology that its new $4.1 million website needs to be fixed after complaints from users.

items.title: The key role a 'lost' reef is playing in South Australia's algal bloom fight
items.summary: A marine ecologist's discovery two years ago sparked a restoration project and has become a key element in South Australia's response to a devastating algal bloom.

items.title: State Administrative Tribunal upholds donkey cull notice at remote Kachana Station in the Kimberley
items.summary: The State Administrative Tribunal rejects an application to review a DPIRD order to cull more than 100 feral donkeys at a remote Kimberley station.

items.title: Experts concerned about WA's anti-vape laws as 'candy store' allegedly sells products near schools
items.summary: Parents and regional business owners say they are concerned about the proliferation of illegal vapes making their way into the country despite repeatedly alerting authorities.

items.title: Study finds adverse links between PFAS exposure and reproductive health in mice
items.summary: A study using mice has found high exposure to PFAS lowered the male's sperm count, decreased testosterone and disrupted embryo development.

items.title: Governor's apology over Pinjarra Massacre renews debate over stripping Stirling name from WA landmarks
items.summary: The WA governor's apology for the Pinjarra Massacre sparks fresh debate over the renaming of roads and places that honour the state's first governor, James Stirling.

items.title: India confirms Shreyas Iyer recovering in hospital with lacerated spleen from ODI incident
items.summary: The Indian team confirms Shreyas Iyer is on the mend after a freak injury left him in hospital with a lacerated spleen in an incident during his side's ODI win over Australia.

items.title: Victorian traditional owner group calls for pause on mining approvals
items.summary: The Federation of Victorian Traditional Owner Corporations calls for a pause on mining approvals until a formal benefit-sharing agreement is in place.

items.title: Federal government investigates Inpex's Darwin oil spill, emissions error
items.summary: An oil spill that leaked into Darwin Harbour and the substantial under-reporting of toxic emissions have put one of Australia's biggest gas companies under federal investigation.

items.title: Kangaroos name Harry Grant as captain for second Ashes Test to replace Isaah Yeo
items.summary: Harry Grant is handed the captaincy of a major representative team for the first time as he is named to lead the Kangaroos in the second Ashes Test.

items.title: Fears Lake Boga algae bloom will impact summer tourism
items.summary: Blue-green algae levels at Lake Boga in Victoria's north-west are three times the safe limit.

items.title: Construction delays on SA's three biggest hospital projects, auditor-general says
items.summary: The South Australian government's three costliest hospital projects have all had "delays in starting construction", according to the auditor-general — but the health minister says they remain on schedule.

items.title: Musicians react to 'random' City of Sydney busking limits in CBD
items.summary: Busking may be a familiar sight on Sydney's George Street, but most key spots for musicians have now been banned.

items.title: Safety authority investigates how cruise ship left woman's body on Lizard Island
items.summary: The Australian Maritime Safety Authority will speak with the crew of a cruise ship that allegedly left behind an 80-year-old Australian woman, who was later found dead on a Queensland tropical island.

items.title: Pacific leader pushing Australia to 'close the deal' on hosting COP31
items.summary: One the Pacific's most high-profile leaders is pressing Anthony Albanese to fly to the global UN climate summit in Brazil next month to "close the deal" with Türkiye and secure COP31 hosting rights for next year.

items.title: When is your tax return due in Australia? Here's what you need to know
items.summary: Time is running out if you are planning on doing your 2024–25 tax return yourself. Here is everything you need to know.

items.title: Optus to be called before senators on Monday to explain triple-0 failure
items.summary: An inquiry into the telco's triple-0 failure was green-lit by the Senate late on Tuesday and will hold its first hearings in Parliament House next week.

items.title: Kamala Harris reveals regret over 'reckless' decision ahead of US election
items.summary: Former US vice-president Kamala Harris reveals she is contemplating another run for the presidency and says she was "reckless" to not stop Joe Biden from pursuing a second term.

items.title: Experts predict lengthy investigation into Cobar underground mine explosion that killed two people
items.summary: A leading Australian expert in mining safety says the investigation into a fatal explosion at a western New South Wales mine could take a long time because "mining is getting more complex".

items.title: Watt defends intervention powers, saying it will not be used to fast track coal and gas
items.summary: Murray Watt warns the Coalition and Greens not to "obstruct" environment laws being introduced to parliament on Thursday, while assuring a special power in the bill would not allow him to intervene on behalf of coal or gas projects.

items.title: England dominate Matildas, win 3-0 in international friendly at Pride Park after Alanna Kennedy sent off
items.summary: The Matildas were criticised for playing at "walking pace" as two-time European champions England dominate at Derby's Pride Park.

items.title: Fawlty Towers actress Prunella Scales dies age 93
items.summary: British actress Prunella Scales, best known for playing Sybil Fawlty in beloved sitcom Fawlty Towers, has died age 93.
